page.title: 18Housing in Hill of Beath
page.content: Much of the housing in our village is council housing.These are mainly terraced and semi-detatched houses.Recently some of the houses were renovated.Next door to the school is the old schoolhouse which the headmaster used to live in but it is no longer used by headmasters.Opposite the school three new bungalows have been built,but only one is occupied yet.Most houses have their own gardens and some years ago Hill of Beath won an award for being the best kept village in Fife.Atthe top of Main Street are a group of flats with three storeys in them.Very few of the houses have garages so cars take up a lot of road space.
